definitions.definition: to put two or more numbers or amounts together to get a total:
examples: If you add (= calculate the total of) three and four you get seven.

definitions.definition: to put something with something else to increase the number or amount or to improve the whole:
examples: Beat the butter and sugar together and slowly add the eggs.
[ + that ] She was sad, she said, but added (= said also) that she felt she had made the right decision.

definitions.definition: abbreviation for Attention Deficit Disorder: a condition in which someone, especially a child, is often in a state of activity or excitement and unable to direct their attention towards what they are doing
